column4: hi.. i'm trying to configure wifi on ubuntu, but iwconfig only shows "lo" and "eth0" devices. shouldn't i have a wlan0 ?
what kind of card is it?(usb/built-un)
it's a built in one. the model is Intel Centrino Advanced-N 6230
according to http://intellinuxwireless.org/  the driver is included in the kernel, so i guess it should be working :s

well  i'm not with the laptop at the moment, but i ran that command earlier and lsusb didn't show anything to do with networking. i tried lspci too and that showed a device Intel Corporation Device 0091 (rev 34)  which i guess is the network card
and it didn't list any kernel drivers associated with it
also every time i boot ubuntu just before the login screen loads it says "too many connections" a couple of times. i don't know if this could be related to my wifi problem?
do you know your kernel version?
i just downloaded and installed ubuntu desktop 10.10 yesterday so it is the kernel which comes with that
kernel version 2.6.38 is known to work with that rev of the card
I suggest you wait a couple of weeks if you can
oh right ok, well thanks for the help. can't i try to upgrade the kernel now and then again in 2 weeks when it becomes stable?
